name: The Minor Prophets Quiz | Old Testament / Tanakh | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many books make up the 'Minor Prophets' of the Old Testament?
questions.explanation:
12.

	Hosea, Joel, Amos, Obadiah, Jonah, Micah, Nahum, Habakkuk, Zephaniah, Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.

questions.text: The prophet Haggai comes on the scene in the second year of King Darius to encourage people to finish an uncompleted project. What was it he wanted the people to do?
options: finish rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem
finish tearing down the idols in the land
finish destroying the enemies of God
questions.explanation:
finish rebuilding the Temple.

	Upon returning from captivity the people had gotten so caught up in their own affairs that they neglected finishing the Temple. The work had ceased for years when Haggai began his ministry.

questions.text: This sycamore-fig farmer warned the people of his day about their complacency, pride and apathy. He uses visions of locust, fire and a plumb line in his message. Who was this prophet?
Hosea was told by God to find 'an adulterous wife'. Whom did he marry?
questions.explanation:
Gomer.

	Hosea is a great story illustrating God's undying love.

questions.text: Which prophet is said to have prophesied the place where Jesus would be born?
questions.explanation:
Micah.

	'But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are small among the clans of Judah, one of you will come for me, one who will be ruler over Israel, whose origins are from of old, from ancient times.' Micah 5:2

questions.text: Why did the great fish swallow Jonah?
questions.correct: Jonah refused to go to Nineveh as God commanded
options: Jonah didn't want to get married
Jonah didn't go to Tarshish as God commanded
questions.explanation: Jonah refused to go to Nineveh as God commanded.

questions.text: Who prophesies the ultimate destruction of Nineveh?
questions.explanation:
Nahum.

	It would appear that the Assyrians, who repented after Jonah's visit, relapsed into idolatry. They had become a violent people. Nahum pronounced divine vengeance upon the city along with a promise of future deliverance to Judah.

questions.text: Which prophet complains to God about unpunished evil in his world and about God using wicked nations to punish nations which are not as wicked?
questions.explanation:
Habakkuk.

	Probably the most famous verse from this book is 'the righteous will live by faith' (Habakkuk 2:4).

questions.text: The Prophet Joel is quoted by which Apostle, in the second chapter of Acts, on the day of Pentecost?
questions.explanation:
Peter.

	Joel 2:28-32 is quoted in Acts 2:17-21.

questions.text: Obadiah's prophecy centers around a feud between what two nations?
questions.explanation:
Israel and Edom.

	The Edomites were descendents of Esau and had a grudge against Israel because Jacob had cheated his brother Esau out of his birthright (Genesis {25:21-32;} 27:41). The Edomites were unsupportive of Israel during their exodus (Numbers 20:14-21, Psalm 137:7). Obadiah prophesied Edom's doom for their pride and wrong against Israel.
